title: zasad@
author: zasad@
content: https://www.ibtimes.com/elon-musk-his-company-fly-bitcoin-moon-3683052Elon Musk And His Company To Fly Bitcoin To The MoonLunarCrush, in a recent press release, revealed its plan to take the world's first digital asset and the world's largest crypto asset by market capitalization Bitcoin to the moon.Since Bitcoin is digital, the proponents of this initiative will send the treasure in the form of a private key to a crypto wallet that contains 62 Bitcoins or approximately $1.7 million, based on the current prevailing rate.___This initiative is a treasure hunt of some sort and will be obtained by the first person who lands on the moon and finds the private key.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: I really wonder where they got the idea to send 62 BTC to Moon, why not 20 or 50 BTC, for example? Apart from that, I don't really like the idea that the private key will be engraved on the rover, and that it will be documented as they say - I hope that this does not mean that there will be a picture of the private key.Although the idea is interesting, I think it will be a very long time until someone starts hunting for "treasure" on the Moon, because the price of traveling there and returning to Earth is far greater than the current value of those BTC, although that value will certainly change in the future. An epic fail would be if the rocket explodes and "burns" those 62 BTC, of course, unless the private key is "documented" somewhere safe.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: The idea is just to literally make BTC go to da mooooon!Â  But who is going to travel going to the moon to hunt the keys?If they have to pay such a huge amount just to get there. Why wouldn't they just use the amount to buy BTC as it's a sure thing they get some BTC than hunting up there.Â  Someone should just tell him which is a good idea and which is a stupid idea.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: bittraffic on April 07, 2023, 03:58:48 PMThe idea is just to literally make BTC go to da mooooon!Â  ~snip~But this idea is actually not new, because I remembered that a few years ago I had already read something similar and it turned out that someone had already come up with a similar idea to send Bitcoin to the moon, only that then the amount was much smaller and it was about physical coin. I can't say how that mission ended and whether it came true at all, but as it started, it seems that this is not the last attempt to send BTC to the Moon, although I personally expect that someone will send it a little further, maybe to Mars

comments.author: karmamiu
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on April 07, 2023, 03:23:40 PMI really wonder where they got the idea to send 62 BTC to Moon, why not 20 or 50 BTC, for example? Apart from that, I don't really like the idea that the private key will be engraved on the rover, and that it will be documented as they say - I hope that this does not mean that there will be a picture of the private key.Although the idea is interesting, I think it will be a very long time until someone starts hunting for "treasure" on the Moon, because the price of traveling there and returning to Earth is far greater than the current value of those BTC, although that value will certainly change in the future. An epic fail would be if the rocket explodes and "burns" those 62 BTC, of course, unless the private key is "documented" somewhere safe.I am also curious too why he chose that number. Maybe it is some kind of easter egg or something? Aside from that I am also concern whether that rocket will explode or not and who would even risk treasure hunting in space even in the future? Who knows how large the space is and where will they even start looking for clues regarding the rocket if it happens it'll explode somewhere and let's just say the priv keys are stored safely on that aircraft.His view towards things is really bizarre. Maybe this is just him feeding his inner childhood fulfilling his dreams or just something due to his inconsistent behavior. We really don't know what's on his mind.

comments.author: zasad@
comments.body: Will our community be putting together an expedition to the moon?

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: zasad@ on April 08, 2023, 02:25:50 PMWill our community be putting together an expedition to the moon? Â  Â I think it's an interesting idea, not because of a treasure hunt or the like, but in the form of promoting the forum. A BTT flag on the Moon or something similar would certainly not cost much, but it is still a serious project that should involve a lot of peopleðŸš€

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Haha omg, what a stunt!Well, considering where Bitcoin might be headed within the next 10+ years, maybe there will truely be an incentive to retrive the keys at some point in time.Meanwhile I am just curious to see to which levels Musk will push Doge and if there will indeed ever be an implementation within twitter.

comments.author: Kakmakr
comments.body: This project is also a "tongue in the cheek" pun to the saying that most Bitcoiners repeat over and over.... namely, that the Bitcoin price is going to the Moon.Â  Â  In any way..... nobody will fund a project to search for those bitcoins now, because that is roughly worth about $1 800 000 now.... but if the price really goes to the Moon.. we might have a new Lazlo event, where those bitcoins might end up being a few hundred million dollars.Â  Elon Musk know how to hype up something... and this is going to get a lot of publicity in the media. So hopefully someone see his vision and take him up on the challenge.

comments.author: cr1776
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on April 07, 2023, 03:23:40 PMI really wonder where they got the idea to send 62 BTC to Moon, why not 20 or 50 BTC, for example?...Perhaps because it is a palindrome in base 5 or perhaps because it has divisors of 2 and 31 and 2^31 is 2147483648?Or maybe in base 3 -> 2022Â  which if you add the digits you have 204 and then rearrange it to 420?Â  lolPerhaps though it has to do with the symbol for element #62:Â  SM

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on April 09, 2023, 10:48:59 AMQuote from: zasad@ on April 08, 2023, 02:25:50 PMWill our community be putting together an expedition to the moon?Â  Â  I think it's an interesting idea, not because of a treasure hunt or the like, but in the form of promoting the forum. A BTT flag on the Moon or something similar would certainly not cost much, but it is still a serious project that should involve a lot of peopleðŸš€hope to be alive to witness something like this happen in the future where multiple groups plans to fly up there to find the coins. and some groups are just waiting to ambush like pirates. the future is getting crazier by the day. or Elon could plan what he will be doing after this like launching reality TV show where participants can go to the moon and find the key. curious to know your view. with such plan in going to the moon, what is it for LunarCrush and Elon ?

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on April 07, 2023, 03:23:40 PMI really wonder where they got the idea to send 62 BTC to Moon, why not 20 or 50 BTC, for example? Probably because at the time of the decision it was worth around $1.5 million and that's the amount of money they were supposed to be getting from their NFT sale.So, it was a publicity stunt to gain some more sales as only 25% of the value of the NFTs will go to the moon!Now, the interesting part will be to watch Elon's reaction!Since this is not something he oversees directly as the rover is the property of another company that just sells space for the trip for whoever wants to buy some, and probably he has found out over Twitter I wouldn't be surprised if he decides to paint the whole rocket with a Shiba picture or demand that at least the rover would need to get a paint job.Quote from: electronicash on April 11, 2023, 04:44:44 PMcurious to know your view. with such plan in going to the moon, what is it for LunarCrush and Elon ?LunarCrush just sold a few million worth of NFTs and SpaceX is getting paid by Lunar Outpost (a different company) to get their rover to the moon!

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Elon Musk never disappoints when he wants the world to get engaged in such activities, thumbs up and another win for bitcoin Btw what Musk did, is one way to fire up people's interest to get into space Â exploration but how much will it cost for an ordinary citizen to get on one of these space shuttle's for this journey to the moon to go treasure hunting..Quote from: zasad@ on April 08, 2023, 02:25:50 PMWill our community be putting together an expedition to the moon? Â  Â Do we have astronauts in our community or anybody will be eligible for this experience Â Quote from: Kryptowerk on April 10, 2023, 04:22:38 PMHaha omg, what a stunt!Well, considering where Bitcoin might be headed within the next 10+ years, maybe there will truely be an incentive to retrive the keys at some point in time.Bounty couldÂ  be worth 5 or 10 times more in the next few year's and if this goes beyond 100millionÂ  or so maybe many people will have the interest to go to the moon hope stuff thereÂ  doesn'tÂ  fade or rot with time.

comments.author: FUCKBSVFUCK
comments.body: I don't think it's a good idea to send the treasure to the moon. There are a lot of people who won't be able to do it, but at least they have the knowledge and the time to do it.Â  Â  As far as I know, the moon is the most powerful moon in the universe, and it's going to be the most powerful moon in the universe.

comments.author: larry_vw_1955
comments.body: Quote from: zasad@ on April 07, 2023, 03:08:13 PMhttps://www.ibtimes.com/elon-musk-his-company-fly-bitcoin-moon-3683052Elon Musk And His Company To Fly Bitcoin To The MoonTech billionaire Elon Musk, his spacecraft engineering company SpaceX, and cryptocurrency company LunarCrush are scheduled to take Bitcoin (BTC) to the moon in the fall of 2023.so how about an update? did they do it or not? because it doesn't seem like they did anything.also, i'm skeptical that they could securely engrave a private key on a rocket without someone on earth having access to be able to see it. how is that even possible?

comments.author: Saint-loup
comments.body: I don't think it's not feasible. For example they can use a script generating a random seed without displaying it, but giving an address belonging to this seed allowing to send funds to it.The script will then write the seed in a file and/or print it on a small sheet of paper once the rocket has reached the moon or a giving date has pasted.

comments.author: larry_vw_1955
comments.body: Quote from: Saint-loup on August 02, 2024, 05:52:40 PMI don't think it's not feasible. For example they can use a script generating a random seed without displaying it, but giving an address belonging to this seed allowing to send funds to it.The script will then write the seed in a file and/or print it on a small sheet of paper once the rocket has reached the moon or a giving date has pasted.but that's the problem though. the private key has to be engraved onto the rocket. that has to be done before it launches. someone is going to be able to see it. because it has to be on a computer before it can be engraved by a computer. not only that but someone could sneak inside the spaceship before it launches and take a peak at the private key.
